Description: Rim sherd of South Ionian pottery cup with everted rim; interior: reserved band at top of rim, glazed below; top of lip glazed; exterior: lip reserved with series of dilute bands; inscription on exterior.
Type series: Vallet and Villard Ionian Cup Type B2
Curator's comments: The lack of diagnostic features makes it very difficult to determine to which type of South Ionian cup with everted rim this cup belongs. The incomplete rim suggests that it may have belonged to a Type 9B cup with a longer rim. Type 9B cups closely follow the shape and decoration of the Attic Plain Komast cups. These cups coincide with Hayes’ Ionian Cup Type IX (Boardman and Hayes 1966, 111-116) and Villard’s Ionian Cup Type B2 (Vallet and Villard, 1964, 87-88). Type 9 cups have been found in large numbers in other sanctuary settings including at the Sanctuary of Demeter and Kore at Tocra, and at the site of Megara Hyblaea on Sicily. This type was the most common type of South Ionian cups with everted rims found at Naukratis. The Type 9 shape evolved from the earlier Type 5 cup shape.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.634) (Phase 3)
